data.title: Invisible newline shown when no newline is present
data.body:
Very small issue. When invisible characters are turned on, the newline character is shown on lines that don't actually have a newline character. Occurs in default + react editors.

To reproduce: turn on invisible characters, create a new file. The newline is shown even though the file is empty.

data.body:
I just installed Atom v0.115.0 on windows 7 x64 using chocolatey. Installation seemed to work fine, but When I launch the app ( with or without elevation ) I can see the menu bar but the editor area is black and just remains black. I tried `New File`, `New Window`, `Reload` but nothing seems to have any effect.

data.title: does atom support multiple selection with find?
data.body:
I just found out to use ctrl+cmd+L to perform multiple line selections in atom. 

In sublime, it is allowed to create multiple cursors from keyword / regex search with the "find all" button. Is this feature available in atom, too?

Thank you.

data.title: Add grammar scope to EditorView
data.body:
**NOTE: This pull request is still work in progress. I just wanted to open it early to keep my intent and progress public, and discoverable.**

The sole purpose of this pull request is to add grammar scope information to `EditorView` instances, so that e.g. editor key bindings can trigger based on grammar. Useful if you want to invoke different build or formatting commands in various packages, for different types of grammars.

Right now I'm solving this by appending CSS classes to the view, but I'm leaning towards adding a `data-scope` attribute instead, to prevent pollution and potential conflicts that might cause all manner of mayhem.

data.title: Ctrl+x without selection should cut line on windows
data.body:
Pressing <kbd>CTRL</kbd>+<kbd>X</kbd> without selecting any text currently removes the next character without adding it to the clipboard, same as <kbd>DELETE</kbd> button.
The expected behaviour from Sublime Text or Visual Studio is to cut the current line.

data.title: Windows behaviour Ctrl+Shift+Home and Ctrl+Shift+End
data.body:
On windows I expect that pressing Ctrl+Shift+Home or Ctrl+Shift+End selects all text from the current marker position to the start or beginning of the file.

This same behaviour exists in all windows native text editors from MS Word to notepad and Sublime Text.

data.title: 'ctrl-shift-z': 'core:redo'
data.body: `Ctrl+Shift+Z` should be mapped to redo by default on Windows. It works in Sublime Text, Notepad++, Notepad, Chrome, _Atom's keybindings search field_... You get the idea.

data.title: Tabs lost after restarting for update
data.body:
When I update, I'd expect my tab state to be saved so that when it restarted, the tabs that were open are reopened.

When that failed, I'd expect to be able to open the last item. The menu item was available, but when I tried, it simply opened a blank editor window.

data.title: close window on last pane
data.body:
fixes #863 

Sets this behavior as the default.

data.title: Dragging shortcuts to folders
data.body: Currently, dragging a shortcut to a folder in Atom (on Windows) opens the `.lnk` file itself rather than the target of the shortcut; the latter behavior would make more sense. I keep a bunch of shortcuts to project folders on my Desktop and it would be nice to be able to drag the shortcuts directly into Atom and have the project itself be opened (rather than the `.lnk`)

data.title: Error on save
'Undo' reverts everything changed in file since opened.
data.body:
**Mac OSx 10.9 - Atom 0.115.0**
Not sure if this is Atom's fault, but is the only editor doing it.  When working on a file if I use "cmd + z" Atom reverts all changes made since I opened that file, not just the last change.  Frustrating!

data.title: Remove unneeded files from distribution
data.body:
After the Windows release, there were several comments/tweets about how many files are in the Atom app distro and it taking awhile to unzip.

This PR takes a look at what files are currently included and removes files that aren't actually needed to run Atom. The result being a smaller download and a faster install.
### Before

Version 0.115.0 on Mac OS X: **2,535 directories, 8,388 files**
### After

| File Type | File Count |
| :-- | --: |
| test | 1250 |
| example | 250 |
| .npmignore | 240 |
| .travis.yml | 150 |
| .h | 150 |
| build | 150 |
| default_app | 65 |
| benchmark | 50 |
| .cc | 40 |
| unused fixtures | 15 |

This PR on Mac OS X: **1,916 directories, 6,011 files**

data.title: Text moves half a pixel when using multiple apps in fullscreen
data.body:
With a two-screen setup on OSX, where Atom in fullscreen is displayed on the first screen, and several other fullscreen applications are displayed on the second, toggling between desktops on the second screen (command + arrow left/right) causes all the text in atom to move half a pixel down or so, making the text become blurred and hard to read.

This error consistently happens, but only if the fullscreen Atom-window is currently up on one of my screens. Whatever instance of Atom that is in fullscreen, but not visible at the time does not appear to display this bug.

Toggling both safe mode and the react editor does nothing to stop this form happening.

The only way I can reset my editor is by exiting fullscreen.

Running OS X yosemite, Retina MBP 15 inch.

```
0.110.0
```

data.title: Continuing Block Comments Automatically
data.body:
This is a feature request, and I'm more than willing to make this change myself and submit it via PR. But I'm new here, and could use some direction on this one! (thanks)

In any case, it would be fantastic if "block comments" (eg: `/* ... */`) would continue automatically (JSDoc style) when multiple lines are added. For example, starting here:

```
/**
 * Some comment...[cursor here]
 */
```

and hitting `Enter`, I would like to end up with:

```
/**
 * Some comment...
 * [cursor here]
 */
```

I know that I can use snippets to automatically generate a JSDoc-style comment, but once the block has been started, I need to manually add the asterisk and the whitespace around it with each new line, which gets tedious quickly.

Here, I'm talking about JS specifically, but I'm sure this could apply to other languages as well.

Is this territory for a plugin? If so, is this type of interaction with the editor (one that doesn't really have a specific keybinding, just part of the user's general typing) possible with the atom API?

data.title: Support multiple separators in context menu
data.body:
Fixes #2847 

This allows multiple separators in context menus by interpreting all objects with the value `-` as separators, rather than just objects which have `-` both as the key and the value. 

cc @kevinsawicki
